amendment.description: Amendment prohibits the National Transportation Safety Board from conducting a study to determine the feasibility of allowing individuals who are more than 60 years of age to pilot commercial aircraft.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 2 in the Congressional Record of June 25, 1996, to prohibit any funds appropriated in the bill from being used by the National Transportation Safety Board to conduct a feasibility study to determine whether or not pilots over the age of 60 years of age should be permitted to fly commercial aircraft.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Collins (GA) amendment (A008) Agreed to by recorded vote: 247 - 159 (Roll no. 291).
